title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 26 January 2017 - XWiki
content:

10:52 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:36 <tmortagne> vmassol: "[WARNING] Rule violated for bundle xwiki-platform-url-scheme-filesystem: instructions covered ratio is 0.37, but expected minimum is 0.39"  
11:38 <vmassol> grr thanks  
11:42 <ol-ow2> has joined #xwiki  
11:54 <ol-ow2> Hi, Main.search (on a child, other children works fine) give me this error : org.xwiki.query.QueryException: Query languages others than XWQL or HQL require programming right, the Main.Search page and XWiki.SearchCode was saved by user which have Prog Rights. Any ideas of where can i find the issue page ? vmassol tmortagne  
11:55 <tmortagne> ol-ow2: what is important is the content author and this one does not change unless you modify the content  
11:57 <ol-ow2> in all case, both have PR tmortagne  
11:57 <ol-ow2> i mean on these two pages  
11:57 <tmortagne> if Main.Search has PR you should not have this error  
11:59 <tmortagne> could you try to edit the page and put $hasProgramming at the beginning of the Velocity macro  
12:00 <ol-ow2> ok, thanks  
12:00 <ol-ow2> i find the real issue, the original author was deleted  
12:01 <tmortagne> ok  
12:01 <ol-ow2> but even if the page was re-saved by user which have PR, the page don't works  
12:01 <tmortagne> if you don't modify the content, yes  
12:02 <ol-ow2> adding a simple space count ? right ?  
12:02 <ol-ow2> space bar\*  
12:02 <tmortagne> yes, any modification  
12:02 <tmortagne> note that solr search API does not require PR anymore (9.0), nightmare will be other soon...  
12:02 <ol-ow2> strange  
12:03 <tmortagne> s/other/over/  
12:03 <ol-ow2> :D  
12:03 <tmortagne> still require the author to have enough right to see the resulting document but wiki admin do it fine for example  
12:04 <ol-ow2> good news  
12:04 <ol-ow2> :)  
12:04 <tmortagne> yep  
12:04 <tmortagne> was a pain on myxwiki.org for everyone  
12:05 <ol-ow2> :)  
12:06 <ol-ow2> Better handling of big attachments ! whoo that's really great  
12:08 <tmortagne> you still have limitation we can't work around on database side but at least that's the last remaining issue now  
12:10 <ol-ow2> currently my problem on 6.4 is when i need to rename / copy / delete a page with more 32Mo of attachments  
12:11 <ol-ow2> but we'ra planning to migrate to 8.x and use filesystem  
12:11 <ol-ow2> anyway, have a good day ;)  
12:12 <ol-ow2> thanks again for your helps  
12:27 <vmassol> has quit  
12:38 <tmortagne> ol-ow2: yes this use case is partially fixed in 9.0 thanks to new document recycle bin filesystem store  
12:39 <tmortagne> there is still an issue with huge history which is not streamed yet  
12:39 <ol-ow2> :)  
12:40 <tmortagne> we still need to allocate some time to fix the last remaning issue to make (recycle bin and attachment) filesystem stores the default stores  
12:53 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
13:05 <vmassol> has quit  
13:21 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
13:43 <flashdel> has joined #xwiki  
13:45 <flashdel> hi folks! I got a problem, i am using xwiki 8.0 with LDAP Authentication. Everything is working fine, except of one problem: the ACLs are not working, if i block a user from viewing a page, he can see it anyway. I am not sure how i can debug this, can somebody give me a hint please?  
13:46 <tmortagne> flashdel: if that user have admin right at wiki level you can't block anything for him  
13:46 <flashdel> he shouldnt have, i will look it up  
13:48 <flashdel> he is not in the XWikiAdminGroup  
13:48 <flashdel> is there maybe another place where he could be set as admin?  
13:57 <OSIMasson1> has joined #xwiki  
13:57 <tmortagne> flashdel: rights can be assigned to groups and users  
13:57 <tmortagne> you could have given admin right to any other group or to the user itself directly  
13:58 <tmortagne> you could try to put  
13:58 <tmortagne> {{velocity}}$hasAdmin{{/velocity}}  
13:58 <tmortagne> in a wiki page to see if you have admin right  
13:59 <flashdel> good point and good test, i will check it right now  
14:00 <flashdel> ok crazy, he has admin rights :o  
14:00 <flashdel> what would be the best and safest way to see in which groups he is in?  
14:15 <tmortagne> flashdel: you mean other than looking at all groups ? :)  
14:16 <flashdel> yes, because i cannot see the user in the groups  
14:17 <tmortagne> {{velocity}}  
14:17 <tmortagne> $xwiki.rightsmanager.getAllGroupsNamesForMember($xcontext.user)  
14:17 <tmortagne> {{/velocity}}  
14:18 <tmortagne> are you in a subwiki or the main wiki ?  
14:18 <tmortagne> (this script only works for groups in the current wiki)  
14:18 <flashdel> i am in the main wiki, so it should work :)  
14:19 <tmortagne> yep  
14:19 <flashdel> mhh he is not in an admin group, all i see is "Main.Department1, XWiki.XWikiAllGroup, Main.All"  
14:22 <tmortagne> maybe one of those groups have admin right  
14:22 <tmortagne> AdminGroup is just a group that have admin right by default but it has nothing special technically  
14:23 <tmortagne> you could even remove admin right for AdminGroup  
14:26 <flashdel> mhh now i accidentally deleted the Administor User from XwikiAll Group and now i cannot revert it, because velocity scripts are forbidden :S  
14:26 <flashdel> arrrghh  
14:29 <flashdel> damn, can i get him back to the group again via CLI?  
14:31 <tmortagne> when you go to XWiki/XWikiAllGroup page do you see the history ?  
14:33 <flashdel> you just saved my day!  
14:34 <flashdel> its working again, thank you!  
14:34 <tmortagne> you're welcome :)

15:29 <ol-ow2> has quit  
15:30 <flashdel> tmortagne: if i give a group the "programming" right, does that mean that all users in that group are admins?  
15:35 <tmortagne> flashdel: they are admin and more yes  
15:35 <tmortagne> programming right is pretty much the same thing as root  
15:50 <OSIMasson1> has joined #xwiki

16:28 <flashdel> tmortagne: ok, i understand, thanks for the info!
